newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Caracas stocks close up, with foreign bids strong.
newsitem.headline: Caracas stocks close up, with foreign bids strong.

text.p: Caracas stocks closed up for the fourth session in a row on strong foreign bids, with the rally seen extending into next week, traders said on Friday.
"We've heard foreign analysts' commentaries that take a very positive view on Venezuela," said Multinvest broker Reinaldo Uribe. "They're very optimistic on the labor reforms."

The lower house of the Venezuelan Congress this week approved a crucial labor reform measure, part of a wider package to overhaul the social security system and liberalize labor markets. The Senate is to consider the measure next week.

The bolsa's 19-share index gained 0.9 percent to end at 6,746.69 points. About 50 million shares, worth 3.7 billion bolivars ($7.6 million), changed hands. Among traded issues, 23 rose, 10 fell and 10 closed unchanged.
Telephone company CANTV led gainers, rising 2.49 percent to 2474.00 bolivars. The rise helped firm Merinvest's composite index, which includes CANTV, 1.38 percent to 107.20.
